name: CATH
details: A hierarchical domain classification of protein structures in the Brookhaven protein databank

name: COG
fullName: Clusters of orthologous groups of proteins
details: Phylogenetic classification of proteins encoded in complete genomes

name: DDBJ
details: All known nucleotide and protein sequences

name: EBI Genomes
details: EBI's collection of databases of complete and unfinished viral , pro- and eukaryotic genomes

name: EGO
details: TIGR database for orthologous genes in Eukaryotes

name: EMBL-Bank
details: Europe's primary nucleotide sequence resource

name: EMBLCDS
details: Database of nucleotide sequences coding sequences

name: EMBLCON
details: Assembly information on all accession.versions and sequence locations for complete genomes and other long sequences (>350kb)

name: Entrez Gene
details: A searchable database of genes, from RefSeq genomes.

name: Entrez Genomes
details: NCBI's searchable collection of complete and incomplete (in-progress) large-scale sequencing, assembly, annotation, and mapping projects for cellular organisms.

name: Entrez-Protein
details: All protein sequences: imported from SwissProt, PIR, PRF, PDB, and translations from annotated coding regions in GenBank and RefSeq

name: EXProt
fullName: EXProt (database for EXPerimentally verified Protein functions)
details: Sequences of proteins with experimentally verified function

name: GenBank
details: Entrez nucleotide sequences from several sources, including GenBank, RefSeq, and PDB

name: GO
details: Gene annotation language database

name: GOA
details: The EBI's Gene Ontology Annotation (GOA) project to provide assignments of GO terms to gene products for all organisms with completely sequenced genomes

name: HGVBase
details: Catalog of normal human gene and genome variation, to be developed into a Phenotype/Genotype database

name: InterPro
fullName: Integrated resource of Protein Families, Domains and Sites
details: A database of protein families, domains and functional sites, provides an integrated view of the commonly used protein signature databases such as PROSITE and Pfam.

name: IPI
details: A database of annotated proteins for a limited number of higher eukaryotic species whose genomic sequence has been completely determined but where there are a large number of predicted protein sequences that are not yet in UniProt.

name: IUBMB Nomenclature database
fullName: International Union of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology Nomenclature database
details: Nomenclature of enzymes, membrane transporters, electron transport proteins and other proteins

name: IUPAC Nomenclature database
fullName: International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry Nomenclature database
details: Nomenclature of biochemical and organic compounds approved by the IUBMB-IUPAC Joint Commission

name: KEGG
fullName: Kyoto encyclopedia of genes and genomes
details: Integrated suite of databases on genes, proteins and metabolic pathways

name: MMDB
details: NCBI's database of macromolecular 3D structures, plus tools for their visualization and comparative analysis

name: MSD
details: EBI's macromolecular structure database

name: NCBI Taxonomy
details: Names of all organisms that are represented in the genetic databases with at least one nucleotide or protein sequence

name: PANTHER
fullName: The PANTHER (Protein ANalysis THrough Evolutionary Relationships) Classification System
details: Classification system for gene products by biological function

name: Patent Abstracts
details: A set of biotechnology-related abstracts of patent applications derived from data products of the European Patent Office (EPO).

name: PDB
details: Protein structure databank: all publicly available 3D structures of proteins and nucleic acids

name: PDB-Ligand
details: 3D structure database of small molecular ligands bound to larger biolomocules deposited in the Protein Data Bank (PDB).

name: PDBTM
fullName: Protein Data Bank of Transmembrane Proteins
details: Transmembrane proteins from the PDB

name: PEDANT
fullName: Protein Extraction, Description and ANalysis Tool
details: Pre-computed analyses of genomic sequences

name: PubMed
details: Database of citations and abstracts to biomedical and other life science journal literature.

name: RefSeq
details: The RefSeq collection aims to provide a comprehensive, integrated, non-redundant set of sequences, including genomic DNA, transcript (RNA), and protein products, for major research organisms.

name: SCOP
details: Structural classification of all proteins of known structure according to their evolutionary, functional and structural relationships.

name: SUPERFAMILY
fullName: Superfamily HMM library and genome assignments server
details: Assignments of proteins to 1539 SCOP structural superfamilies

name: Swiss-Prot
details: Now UniProt/Swiss-Prot: expertly curated protein sequence database, section of the UniProt knowledgebase

name: TargetDB
details: Target data from worldwide structural genomics projects, provides status and tracking information on the progress of the production and solutions of structures

name: TCDB
details: Transport Classification database for membrane transport proteins

name: TIGR CMR
fullName: The Institute for Genomic Research Comprehensive Microbial Resource
details: Information on all of the publicly available, complete prokaryotic genomes.

name: TIGR GI
fullName: The Institute for Genomic Research Gene Indices
details: Organism-specific databases of publicly available EST and gene sequences and analyses

name: TIGR MDB
fullName: The Institute for Genomic Research Microbial resource
details: Alphabetical listing of published TIGR Microbial genomes

name: TOPS
details: Database of topological descriptions of protein structures

name: TransportDB
fullName: Genomic Comparisons of Membrane transport Systems
details: Database describing the predicted cytoplasmic membrane transport protein complement for organisms whose complete genome sequence is available

name: UniParc
details: A comprehensive repository, reflecting the history of all protein sequences.

name: UniProt
details: Repository of protein sequence and function created by joining the information contained in Swiss-Prot, TrEMBL, and PIR

name: UniProtKB
details: The central access point for extensive curated protein information, including function, classification, and cross-reference

name: UniRef
details: Non-redundant Reference database combines closely related sequences into a single record to speed searches

name: UniVec
details: Vector sequences, adapters, linkers and primers used in DNA cloning, and tools to check for vector contamination

name: VectorDB
details: Sequences of cloning vectors

name: unspecified
details: Unspecified database
